folder: Montague Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Montague Street, south side, between Clinton and Court Streets. At the extreme right is the U.S. Court, next to it the Academy of Design, and next to the last mentioned the Academy of Music. At the left of the Music Hall, a saloon was opened in 1860 by Andrew Suydam, later acquired by John M. Groarty (1881) who also owned the Oceanus House at Rockaway Beach.

1870.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Clinton Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY
text: (1) Clinton Street, at the N. W. corner of Montague Street, showing the Holy Trinity Protestant Episcopal Church. The foundation for this edifice, of which Edgar John Bart was the builder, was begun in August 1844. The chapel opened for services on June 7, 1846, and the church on April 25, 1847. The steeple, which was erected in 1860, was removed in 1906. Two buildings (not in this view) at Nos. 122-124 Pierrepont Street were given to the parish by George Foster Peabody in 1905 and 1912, to be used as a guildhouse and parish house. The rectory was purchased in 1897, and is at No. 126 Pierrepont Street. The church proper cost $175,000; the spire 275 feet in height, cost an additional $65,000. Minard Lefevre was the architect. About 1906 Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.  (2) The Montague Street side of the church, viewing eastward. The 3 ½ story building on the extreme left is the Trinity Club. March 1, 1929 P. L. Sperr  (3) Another view of the church, viewing northwestward across the roof of the Brooklyn Trust Company building (right foreground). March 1, 1929 P. L. Sperr

folder: Montague Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
Montague Street, N.E. corner of Clinton Street; a view of the Brooklyn Trust Co., first of its kind in Brooklyn, established in 1866. At extreme right, is the National City Bank on Montague Street.

1914.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

folder: Montague Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text: Montague Street, north side, at Clinton Street. A view of Holy Trinity Church (now known as St. Ann's Church)

folder: Montague Street & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1) 189-203 Montague Street, north side, between Clinton and Court Streets. The Montague Street Branch of the Brooklyn Public Library is seen at No. 197. February 22, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle. June 2, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Clinton Street & Montague Street, Brooklyn, NY
text:
(1)
Clinton Street, east side, south from Montague Street.
November 10, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a view from the opposite direction. At the S.E. corner of Remsen and Clinton Streets is seen the Spencer Memorial Presbyterian Church.
November 10, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
